Class Boss

java.lang.Object
application.model.boss.Boss
All Implemented Interfaces:
Animatable, Damageable
Direct Known Subclasses:
DragonBoss, GolemBoss, SkeletonBoss, SlimeBoss
public abstract class Boss extends Object implements Damageable, Animatable
Base class for all bosses in the game. Implements both Damageable and Animatable interfaces, providing shared behavior for health management and sprite animation. Inheritance hierarchy: 
   Boss (abstract) implements Damageable, Animatable
     ├── SlimeBoss      — easy, slow trash lines
     ├── SkeletonBoss   — medium difficulty
     ├── GolemBoss      — tanky, heavy attacks
     └── DragonBoss     — hardest, fast trash lines

  • Field Details

    • name

      protected String name
      Display name of this boss (e.g., "Slime King").

    • maxHealth

      protected int maxHealth
      Maximum health points. Set by subclass based on stage scaling.

    • bossType

      protected BossType bossType
      The type identifier for this boss.

    • trashLineIntervalMs

      protected long trashLineIntervalMs
      Interval in milliseconds between boss trash line attacks. Lower = more aggressive. Set by each subclass.

    • idleFrames

      protected String[] idleFrames
      Array of 2 resource paths for the idle animation frames. e.g., {"/images/bosses/slime_idle_0.png", "/images/bosses/slime_idle_1.png"}

    • attackPool

      protected List<GameAction> attackPool
      Pool of possible attacks this boss can use. Populated by initAttacks() in each subclass.

  • Constructor Details

    • Boss

      protected Boss(int maxHealth)
      Initializes the base boss with the given max health. Subclasses must call this via super(maxHealth) and then set their own name, bossType, trashLineIntervalMs, idleFrames, and call initAttacks().
      Parameters:
      maxHealth - the maximum (and starting) health for this boss

  • Method Details

    • initAttacks

      protected abstract void initAttacks()
      Configures the attack pool for this boss. Called at the end of each subclass constructor.

    • takeDamage

      public void takeDamage(int amount)
      Inflicts the specified amount of damage on this entity. Health should not drop below zero. Health is clamped to a minimum of 0.
      Specified by:
      takeDamage in interface Damageable
      Parameters:
      amount - the amount of damage to deal (must be >= 0)

    • getHealth

      public int getHealth()
      Returns the current health of this entity.
      Specified by:
      getHealth in interface Damageable
      Returns:
      current health points

    • getMaxHealth

      public int getMaxHealth()
      Returns the maximum health of this entity.
      Specified by:
      getMaxHealth in interface Damageable
      Returns:
      maximum health points

    • isAlive

      public boolean isAlive()
      Checks whether this entity is still alive (health > 0).
      Specified by:
      isAlive in interface Damageable
      Returns:
      true if health > 0, false otherwise

    • getCurrentFramePath

      public String getCurrentFramePath()
      Returns the resource path of the current animation frame image. The path is relative to the resources root (e.g., "/images/bosses/slime_idle_0.png"). Returns the resource path for the current idle animation frame.
      Specified by:
      getCurrentFramePath in interface Animatable
      Returns:
      resource path string for the current frame

    • getFrameCount

      public int getFrameCount()
      Returns the total number of animation frames in the cycle.
      Specified by:
      getFrameCount in interface Animatable
      Returns:
      number of frames (e.g., 2 for a 2-frame idle animation)

    • nextFrame

      public void nextFrame()
      Advances the animation to the next frame, wrapping around to frame 0 when the last frame is reached. Toggles between frame 0 and frame 1 (for 2-frame idle animation).
      Specified by:
      nextFrame in interface Animatable

    • chooseAttack

      public GameAction chooseAttack()
      Randomly selects an attack from this boss's attack pool.
      Returns:
      a randomly chosen GameAction from the attack pool

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Returns:
      the display name of this boss

    • getBossType

      public BossType getBossType()
      Returns:
      the type identifier for this boss

    • getTrashLineIntervalMs

      public long getTrashLineIntervalMs()
      Returns:
      the interval in milliseconds between trash line attacks

    • getHealthPercentage

      public double getHealthPercentage()
      Returns the health percentage (0.0 to 1.0) for the health bar display.
      Returns:
      health ratio

      Overrides:
